title: Bug 6322 - All types dialog displays obfuscated classes
description: The All Types dialog displays obfuscated classes in JDK 1.4, including classes like 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc.
OB: When using the All Types dialog, obfuscated classes, such as 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc., are prominently visible in the list of available classes.
EB: The All Types dialog should only display non-obfuscated, user-friendly class names from JDK 1.4.
SR:
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Open the software. 
2. Access the 'All Types' dialog, e.g., by navigating to 'Tools' > 'All Types.' 
3. Observe the list of classes displayed in the dialog, which includes obfuscated classes like 'a,' 'a1,' 'b,' 'c,' 'd,' etc.
